column4: it says job control turned off and goes back to a help prompt
how do i install ubuntu 7.04 if it goes to a job control turned off mode when i boot up the cd?
says something about tty and job control turned off
help please
what the problem ?
are u using the ubuntu 7.04 live cd or the alternate cd ?
where did you download it from ?
okay you got the cd from shipit. Waht version is it ?
you need to put the cd in the drive and then boot the computer from the cd
you need to check if it the richt version: 64 bits, 32 bits, mac, it on the cd-sleeve.
no mention of 64 bits  then
could be. if it boots it goes straight into the # prompt ?
I have no clue. Could be a wrong cd, indeed.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=415009&page=11
apparently some other people have those problems too.
http://www.google.com/search?q=ubuntu+feisty+install+tty+job+controll+turned&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=com.ubuntu:en-US:official&client=firefox-a
you can boot it from wind*ws
you could try Knoppix or Mepis, see if they boot, you need to DL them and burn them. Maybe you have some special hardware ?
did you check the URL I send ?
yes, so that maybe why you don't get much help... google around, see if some has a solution.... NOAPIC might help, in the boot options during boot... but who know... 1
Normally, youl have a fully working ubuntu gnu/linux system when you boot off the cd. However, on some motherboards it dont work... I had a VIA chipset that I couldnt get to work...
mine doesn work either.... I am waiting download of another....
meanwhile helping out a bit...
optimist! maybe try dapper, it has long term support.
